qas.question: Why did the mistranslation of szlachta come about?

answers.text: included those almost rich and powerful enough to be magnates down to rascals

qas.question: Who was inferior of the other, European countries or szlachta?

context: In the past, a certain misconception sometimes led to the mistranslation of "szlachta" as "gentry" rather than "nobility".:206 :xvi This mistaken practice began due to the economic status of some <a1_0>szlachta<a1_0/> members being inferior to that of the nobility in other European countries (see also Estates of the Realm regarding wealth and nobility). The szlachta <a0_0>included those almost rich and powerful enough to be magnates down to rascals<a0_0/> with a noble lineage, no land, no castle, no money, no village, and no peasants.:xvi
